thinking about time for a long time um isaac newton um was
considered that time was absolute uh that we could only perceive time
based on uh observation so time was the sort of immutable
running along we couldn't affect it it couldn't be affected by anything we could only observe it through
movement of planets or apples falling on our heads or whatever
einstein on the other hand argued fairly convincingly that that time is relative
and actually it can be different for different observers depending on you know how fast they're going
gravity effects and stuff like that and then there's also the third view
so we don't have to figure out who was right i think the jury's still out on that one
but it is you know fairly clear that time and time synchronization has been
important to society and to us for hundreds of years so you know from
the very early sort of chinese water towers um that had big gongs and and bells and
things that that actually signaled to the population what the time was uh on a regular basis
to just down the road as it happens so about two miles down the road is greenwich and um
the clock on the bottom left there is is the shepherd's gate clock which was the first
slave clock face that was shown to the public to to actually tell them what greenwich mean time was and
greenwich meantime was invented it was the first proper official synchronization of time
so before greenwich meantime came along you had local time and usually uh in in countries like
england you would set your clock from the railway station clock so that would be the accurate local time and that was
set probably from the sundial believe it or not but because of the difference in in
longitude that there would be a half hour difference between the east and the west in
england and obviously in bigger countries like america that's a much bigger problem um so the need to synchronize clocks um

everything now depends on time and synchronization so from communications

time is incredibly important

for pretty much everything you look at so you know when i started to put a sort of

on the distributed system for forensics when did something happen
if you're looking back at historical records of you know events on a network you need to

communication protocols like bluetooth or whatever they all depend on accurate timing for packets to

anti-replay you know time stamping packets um cryptocurrency and blockchain proof of
work you know you have to have an accurate pool of clocks um such that one say bitcoin is produced
every 10 minutes globally and that that pool of clocks um needs to be
and the ledgers involved need to be obviously synchronized or the whole thing falls apart
so you can go on and on everything pretty much depends on it
